AcquiredItemFlag.description: Represents an item or game state whose acquisition/status is a boolean flag, often affecting conditional logic.

id.description: A unique identifier for this flag.

itemName.description: Name/identifier of the item or state being flagged.

promptText.description: Optional text to be displayed to the user for prompts related to this flag (e.g., "Did you get a Zombie Strike weapon?").

setType.description: How the application determines the state of this flag.

sourceDescription.description: Textual description of where/how this item/state is acquired or determined.

AcquiredItemFlagSetType.description: Defines how an item flag's state is determined or set.

enemyName.description: The name of the enemy or battle.

itemAcquisitionFlags.description: Array of item/state flags relevant to this battle (e.g., specific item drops to check for).

notes.description: Optional textual notes pertaining to the battle, displayed after the main strategy.

strategy.description: Array of strategy steps, which can include list items or conditional blocks.

trackedResourceUpdates.description: Array of tracked resource updates associated with this battle (e.g., drops).

strategy.description: Array of strategy items for playing the Blitzball game.

CSRBehavior.description: Behavior of an instruction/element based on Cutscene Remover (CSR) mod status.

Chapter.description: Represents a single chapter in the guide.

content.description: An array of content blocks that make up the chapter.

title.description: The display title of the chapter.

ChapterContent.description: A union of all possible block-level content types within a chapter.

CharacterCommand.description: Represents a command or action performed by a character.

characterName.description: Name of the character performing the action.

itemAcquisitionFlags.description: Item flags set directly by this command.

subItems.description: For commands with further itemized details (e.g., Blitzball shot options).

trackedResourceUpdates.description: Resources updated directly by this command.

CharacterReference.description: Represents a reference to a game character, including styling.

ConditionalBlock.description: Represents a block of content that is displayed conditionally.

additionalNote.description: One-off textual notes related to the conditional.

bothContent.description: Content to display if the Blitzball result is "both" (for LaTeX source that handles all three cases).

conditionSource.description: The source or type of the condition being evaluated.

contentToShowIfFalse.description: Content to display if the resource check condition is false.

contentToShowIfTrue.description: Content to display if the resource check condition is true.

displayAsItemizedCondition.description: If true, indicates the \blitzballdetermination was wrapped in an itemized condition like "\item \textit{If you won/lost blitz:}".

elseContent.description: Optional content to display if the `textCondition` is NOT met (for explicit "else" branches).

flagName.description: The name or ID of the AcquiredItemFlag to check.

itemAcquisitionFlags.description: Item flags that might be set as a result of a choice within this conditional.

lossContent.description: Content to display if the Blitzball result is "loss" or the primary if/then condition is false.

notes.description: General notes for the entire conditional block.

options.description: Array of distinct conditional options the user can choose from or that describe different scenarios.

resourceName.description: Name of the tracked resource to check (e.g., "Grenade").

textCondition.description: The textual representation of the "if..." part of the condition.

thenContent.description: Content to display if the `textCondition` is met or evaluated as true.

thenContentForAll.description: For complex if/then/else structures in LaTeX that had a common "then" part after specific branches.

value.description: The value to compare the resource count against.

winContent.description: Content to display if the Blitzball result is "win" or the primary if/then condition is true.

ConditionalOption.description: Represents one option within a multi-choice conditional block.

conditionText.description: The text describing the condition for this option (e.g., "With Sleeping Powder:").

content.description: The content (instructions, blocks) that applies if this option is chosen.

EncountersBlock.description: Represents a block detailing general encounter strategies for an area.

content.description: List items or conditional blocks detailing encounter strategies.

itemAcquisitionFlags.description: Item flags relevant to general encounters in this area.

notes.description: General notes for encounters in the area.

trackedResourceUpdates.description: Tracked resources gained from general encounters in this area.

EquipBlock.description: Represents an equipment setup or change.

content.description: List items or conditional blocks detailing equipment changes.

FormattedText.description: Represents text with specific formatting (bold, italic, color, etc.).

displayHint.description: Hint for special display, like centered headers.

value.description: Optional value associated with the macro (e.g., time for \cs[3:40], item name for \pickup).

InlineElement.description: A union of all possible inline (text-level) element types.

InstructionListBlock.description: Represents an ordered (enumerate) or unordered (itemize) list.

ordered.description: True if the list is ordered (e.g., <ol>), false for unordered (e.g., <ul>).

resume.description: True if the list enumeration should resume from a previous list.

ListItemElement.description: Represents a single item in a list (\item).

content.description: The main content of the list item, can be a mix of inline elements or nested block structures.

csrBehavior.description: Behavior of this item based on CSR mod status.

csrNote.description: Optional note related to CSR behavior (e.g., "(Ignore if playing with CSR)").

itemAcquisitionFlags.description: Optional item flags set by this list item.

subContent.description: Optional further indented sub-items or content not part of a formal nested list block.

trackedResourceUpdates.description: Optional resources updated by this list item (e.g., a \pickup command).

symbol.description: The symbol, either as raw LaTeX (e.g., "\leftarrow") or a pre-processed representation.

PlainTextElement.description: Represents a segment of plain, unformatted text.

gilInfo.description: Textual information about Gil requirements or totals for the shop.

sections.description: Sections within the shop, typically "Sell" and "Buy".

ShopSection.description: Represents a section within a shop (e.g., "Sell" or "Buy").

items.description: Items listed under this section, can include conditionals.

content.description: Content of the sphere grid, can be character-specific actions, conditionals, images, or general list items.

contextInfo.description: Optional context information for the sphere grid (e.g., character name, condition like "4 Return Spheres").

SphereGridCharacterActions.description: Represents sphere grid actions for a specific character.

actions.description: Array of actions/steps on the grid, can include conditionals.

associatedImages.description: Optional image associated with this character's grid segment.

character.description: Name of the character whose grid is being modified.

inlineCondition.description: Optional inline condition text (e.g., "If no OD").

slvlInfo.description: Optional information about S.Levels required or gained.

trackedResourceUpdates.description: Tracked resource updates (e.g., sphere consumption) for this entire grid segment.

content.description: Array of inline elements that make up the paragraph.

displayHint.description: Optional hint for special display, like the emphasized "READ EVERY LINE" blocks.

TrackedResource.description: Represents a consumable resource whose quantity is tracked (e.g., Power Spheres, Speed Spheres, Grenades).

condition.description: Optional condition text if this resource update itself is conditional on a prior state/event.

description.description: Optional textual description of the source/reason for this update (e.g., "From Tros Overkill").

id.description: A unique identifier for this specific resource update instance, for the app to prevent double-counting.

name.description: Name of the resource being tracked.

quantity.description: Quantity of the resource gained (positive) or consumed (negative). For user-confirmed consumption, this might be the max/target.

updateType.description: How the application should handle this resource update.

TrackedResourceUpdateType.description: Defines the type of update for a tracked resource.

TrialBlock.description: Represents a Cloister of Trials puzzle.

itemAcquisitionFlags.description: Item flags set upon completing the trial.

steps.description: Array of steps to solve the trial.

trackedResourceUpdates.description: Tracked resources gained from completing the trial.

acknowledgements.description: Direct content of acknowledgements, if not using a separate file.

acknowledgementsFile.description: Path to a separate JSON file for acknowledgements (modular approach).

chapterFiles.description: Array of paths to individual chapter JSON files (modular approach).

chapters.description: Direct array of chapter objects, if not using separate files.

introduction.description: Direct content of the introduction, if not using a separate file.

introductionFile.description: Path to a separate JSON file containing the introduction content (modular approach).

title.description: The main title of the speedrun guide.
